meanings.definition: To produce more offspring than another organism.
meanings.sent1: The rabbits in the field outreproduce the squirrels.
meanings.sent2: Some plants can outreproduce others in the wild.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to outreproduce the beetles for a change.
meanings.sent4: The bacteria seemed to outreproduce at an astonishing rate.
meanings.sent5: In the race for survival, the fish must outreproduce their predators.

meanings.sent1: The virus managed to outreproduce all other viruses in the area.
meanings.sent2: Certain insects have the ability to outreproduce their competitors.
meanings.sent3: The flowers seemed determined to outreproduce the weeds in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The invasive species can outreproduce the native plants easily.
meanings.sent5: To outreproduce in a changing environment requires adaptability and resilience.

meanings.definition: To have a higher rate of reproduction than others.
meanings.sent1: The mice population can outreproduce the owls in the forest.
meanings.sent2: Some fish species can outreproduce others in the same habitat.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria were determined to outreproduce the antibiotics.
meanings.sent4: The insects seemed to outreproduce in the warm summer months.
meanings.sent5: To outreproduce efficiently, organisms must adapt to their environment.
